baigan bharta.author: Ed U.
baigan bharta.review:
I was in a particularly zen mood when I entered this familiar Indian restaurant because I just came out of a low and slow afternoon at the Kabuki Springs & Spa down the block. After all, it was men-only Monday, so I was au naturale in the hot bath but fortunately not at this restaurant. No, I was fully clothed and feeling quite serene in here, even though I recall taking advantage of their busy all-you-can-eat buffet more than a decade back, probably stuffing my gullet with chewy naan and saucy korma. Those gluttonous days are gone (fingers crossed), and I decided to keep it light, at least as light as my head was feeling. A complimentary flat of papadum arrived on my table with three flavorful dipping sauces (photo: http://bit.ly/2iL45vC).

Just wished there was more papadum. From there, I started my true order with the $4.95 Cucumber Tomato Salad, a simple and small plate of freshness with tomato slices covered fort-like by cucumber slices lightly seasoned with chat masala and accompanied by a vinegary dipping sauce (photo: http://bit.ly/2kl1Y1N). For my entree, I ordered an old veggie favorite, the $10.95 Baigan Bharta, clay oven-roasted eggplant cooked into a stew-like consistency with green peas & spices in an onion & tomato gravy (photo: http://bit.ly/2BwU6O9). Quite hearty and tasty with plenty of umami flavor and complemented nicely by the $2.95 dish of Basmati Rice (photo: http://bit.ly/2AoBGSr). So I did manage to keep things light and maintain my sense of calm. Ummmmmmm.

FOOD - 4 stars...a surprisingly refreshing Indian vegan meal
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...the space looks more open than it did before
SERVICE - 4 stars...efficient & polite
TOTAL - 4 stars...a fine post-bath meal if Dosa is packed

excerpts: I always find myself craving their Daal soup & the Baigan Bharta.
While I've never eaten in, the inside of the restaurant looks nice and cozy, with white linen covered tables.
Good dinner option for a night out on Filmore St at a more affordable price point than DOSA down the block.
I appreciate the fact that they have a good variety of vegan/vegetarian options, also
when they mean spicy, they mean SPICY (Thank you) :D
baigan bharta.author: Daniella O.
baigan bharta.review:
One of my favorite Indian food places to order delivery from.
I always find myself craving their Daal soup & the Baigan Bharta. While I've never eaten in, the inside of the restaurant looks nice and cozy, with white linen covered tables. Good dinner option for a night out on Filmore St at a more affordable price point than DOSA down the block. I appreciate the fact that they have a good variety of vegan/vegetarian options, also when they mean spicy, they mean SPICY (Thank you) :D

excerpts: Baigan Bharta (eggplant curry):
Too oily.
Did not have peas as promised in the menu.
baigan bharta.author: Gene G.
baigan bharta.review:
Chicken Tikka Kebab: The portion was generous, however the chicken was dry and had no flavor. The menu claimed it is marinated- it clearly had not been.

Baigan Bharta (eggplant curry): Too oily. Did not have peas as promised in the menu. Flavor was OK.

Saag Paneer: Too oily. Good flavor though.

Kabuli Naan: Good flavor, however for $4 it was too small. Other than the pink, shredded coconut, you couldn't taste or see any of the other ingredients it was supposed to have.

Samosas: Crispy and chewy- I think they use a little cornstarch in the dough. Filling was flavorful.

Vegetarian Momos: The filling was unremarkable- some kind of green paste with no defining flavor. The dough was some kind of thin, translucent rice paper or cornstarch mixture- not at all what you expect from momos. The skins dried out almost immediately. They try to mitigate this by brushing them in oil- yuck.

Service was polite and the decor/ambiance pleasant. Would not return for the food though.

excerpts: The daal makhani and the biryani were standout.
It's not the best I've ever had, but the the best I've had in SF.
Will definitely return.
daal makhani.author: R M.
daal makhani.review: Split the Vegetarian Thali for 2 with a side of chicken biryani. Of the 5 Indian places in the city I've tried it has been by far the best. Ordering our meal "spicy" actually resulted in spicy food. The daal makhani and the biryani were standout. It's not the best I've ever had, but the the best I've had in SF. Will definitely return.

excerpts: But the chicken tikka masala was pretty decent, the bhindi masala good, and the saag paneer passed my wife's saag paneer test.
Don't get me wrong, I am grading on a curve here..but expectations exceeded, so will order again.
If the quality drops, I reserve the right to reconsider my generosity.
bhindi masala.author: Gibu T.
bhindi masala.review: Was conflicted between giving 4 or 5 stars, and perhaps we can chalk this up to my low expectations when I ordered, I am going to be generous. Saffron Grill has gone downhill these days, it used to be my go to place. So I was really hoping for a new place to pop up, but anytime you see a crazy number of 5-star reviews by a predominantly newbie crowd, you tend to be suspicious, as I was. But the chicken tikka masala was pretty decent, the bhindi masala good, and the saag paneer passed my wife's saag paneer test. Don't get me wrong, I am grading on a curve here..but expectations exceeded, so will order again. If the quality drops, I reserve the right to reconsider my generosity.

excerpts: My wife and i ordered the butter chicken masala and vegetarian mushroom Matar.
It was perfectly cooked fresh.
It was not too spicy and the sauce was savory with sweet tomatoe undertones...
Kabuli naan was pretty good too.
mushroom matar.author: Allen W.
mushroom matar.review: This place is under new management.  It does not have the buffet anymore but they really beautified the establishment with new chairs and decor..  Its really nice and intimate. My wife and i ordered the butter chicken masala and vegetarian mushroom Matar. It was perfectly cooked fresh.  It was not too spicy and the sauce was savory with sweet tomatoe undertones... Kabuli naan was pretty good too.

excerpts: I've gotten their saag paneer, paneer tikka masala, vegetable korma, and malai kofta.
Everything has been excellent.
Great spot for vegetarians!
malai kofta.author: Shelby B.
malai kofta.review: I eat here probably more than I should. This isn't a place for really spicy Indian dishes, it's more for creamy, indulgent flavors. I love it. If I'm extra hungry at first I'll get the veggie momo's which are excellent. I've gotten their saag paneer, paneer tikka masala, vegetable korma, and malai kofta. Everything has been excellent. Great spot for vegetarians!

excerpts: We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta.
Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for.
I especially recommend the malai kofta.
They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food.
The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately.
malai kofta.author: Apoorva A.
malai kofta.review:
Delicious food! We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta. Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for. I especially recommend the malai kofta. They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food. The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately. I ordered a serrano chili naan, which I really loved and recommend.

We came during lunch time on a Sunday, and it was pretty busy. Turns out, this place is owned by the same people who run Om Indian Cuisine in Haight-Ashbury, and they just opened another restaurant as well. The ambience is alright, a little dark (I think Om does a better job here). Service was also a little slow. They brought out our three different appetizers one at a time, perhaps in order to buy time for the entrees, which came a good 25 minutes after the order was placed. However, it was well worth the wait, and, overall, made for a great meal.

excerpts: Excellent malai kofta, great bread, and friendly service.
I was dining alone, that night, and the staff didn't give me any attitude, or try to sit me at the worst table.
I can't wait to go back to try other dishes!
malai kofta.author: Thomas D.
malai kofta.review: Excellent malai kofta, great bread, and friendly service. I was dining alone, that night, and the staff didn't give me any attitude, or try to sit me at the worst table. I can't wait to go back to try other dishes!

excerpts: The malai kofta and kabuli naan are particularly delicious, as is the kebab.
malai kofta.author: Lane E.
malai kofta.review: Had a lot of Indian food. This is the best. The malai kofta and kabuli naan are particularly delicious, as is the kebab.

excerpts: Tikka masala, baingan bharta and malai kofta were mediocre.
Too creamy for me.
Would definitely come back for the okra though!
malai kofta.author: Kendy L.
malai kofta.review: Okra and naan were amazing. Tikka masala, baingan bharta and malai kofta were mediocre. Too creamy for me. Would definitely come back for the okra though!

excerpts: Also solid were the butter chicken and daal saag.
I'd return!
daal saag.author: Andrew K.
daal saag.review: Most of the reviews are fake for sure, but I liked it, especially the missi roti (chick pea bread). Also solid were the butter chicken and daal saag. I'd return!

excerpts: We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta.
Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for.
I especially recommend the malai kofta.
They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food.
The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately.

Delicious food! We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta. Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for. I especially recommend the malai kofta. They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food. The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately. I ordered a serrano chili naan, which I really loved and recommend.

We came during lunch time on a Sunday, and it was pretty busy. Turns out, this place is owned by the same people who run Om Indian Cuisine in Haight-Ashbury, and they just opened another restaurant as well. The ambience is alright, a little dark (I think Om does a better job here). Service was also a little slow. They brought out our three different appetizers one at a time, perhaps in order to buy time for the entrees, which came a good 25 minutes after the order was placed. However, it was well worth the wait, and, overall, made for a great meal.

excerpts: We ordered kadai paneer but got chicken pieces along with paneer.
When we asked them to check, first they mentioned it should be paneer
but we requested them to check with chef
and they confirmed it was chicken indeed and then mentioned it is "No problem" for them and can prepare a new one.
It may be no problem but its a big deal for vegetarians.
We left the place immediately.
Horrible experience
kadai paneer.author: Pray D.
kadai paneer.review: VEGETARIANS AVOID THIS PLACE! We ordered kadai paneer but got chicken pieces along with paneer. When we asked them to check, first they mentioned it should be paneer but we requested them to check with chef and they confirmed it was chicken indeed and then mentioned it is "No problem" for them and can prepare a new one. It may be no problem but its a big deal for vegetarians. We left the place immediately. Horrible experience

excerpts: The vegetable korma and vegetable tikka masala were both amazingly flavorful, full to the brim with vegetables, and not too heavy.
I would also recommend getting the kabuli naan because the sweetness of the cherries baked into the naan complements the creamy sauces perfectly, and all of the naan portions are enormous.
The food was so good that we ate every last bite even though we weren't very hungry!
We're looking forward to our next visit.
vegetable tikka masala.author: Vijay N.
vegetable tikka masala.review: The korma and masala are heavenly, and the service felt warm and personal compared to last year.  We stopped in for an early dinner last weekend and were immediately seated. We got an unexpected free serving of excellent papadum and chutneys to start the meal. The vegetable korma and vegetable tikka masala were both amazingly flavorful, full to the brim with vegetables, and not too heavy. I would also recommend getting the kabuli naan because the sweetness of the cherries baked into the naan complements the creamy sauces perfectly, and all of the naan portions are enormous. The food was so good that we ate every last bite even though we weren't very hungry! We're looking forward to our next visit.

excerpts: We also ordered vegetable tikka masala, which was creamy and full of vegetables.
To finish the meal we got an order of garlic naan, which was fresh, warm and covered in delicious garlic.
Will definitely return to try more of what the menu has to offer!
vegetable tikka masala.author: Mary S.
vegetable tikka masala.review: This restaurant certainly earned its 5 star rating! We came in around 6pm on a Thursday and we're seated immediately. For starters, we ordered the samosas and vegetable momo. The samosas were incredibly flavorful and cooked to perfection. The momos had a nice mix of flavors and spicy sauce on the side. We also ordered vegetable tikka masala, which was creamy and full of vegetables. To finish the meal we got an order of garlic naan, which was fresh, warm and covered in delicious garlic. Will definitely return to try more of what the menu has to offer!

excerpts: I got chicken vindaloo with garlic naan and my friends got chicken tikka masala, butter chicken masala, chicken korma.
They were all delicious!
butter chicken masala.author: Theresa H.
butter chicken masala.review: We went here for dinner on a Sunday. There was no wait and got a table right away. The food was great- portions were big and flavorful! I got chicken vindaloo with garlic naan and my friends got chicken tikka masala, butter chicken masala, chicken korma. They were all delicious!

excerpts: We got the samosa, chicken tikka masala and butter chicken masala.
Everything was really good and the service was amazing.
They were on top of their service.
Their heat level was very low.
We got the spicy and the guy kept warning us and asking are we sure.
We got it and tried it we all agreed it was mild at best.
Great food, amazing service!
butter chicken masala.author: Sarah T.
butter chicken masala.review: My friend wanted to go here and I must say I was dragging my feet trying to convince him otherwise. Boy am I glad I'm not such a great convincer because the food was really good. We got the samosa, chicken tikka masala and butter chicken masala. Everything was really good and the service was amazing. They were on top of their service. Their heat level was very low. We got the spicy and the guy kept warning us and asking are we sure. We got it and tried it we all agreed it was mild at best. Great food, amazing service!

excerpts: My wife and i ordered the butter chicken masala and vegetarian mushroom Matar.
It was perfectly cooked fresh.
It was not too spicy and the sauce was savory with sweet tomatoe undertones...
Kabuli naan was pretty good too.
butter chicken masala.author: Allen W.
butter chicken masala.review: This place is under new management.  It does not have the buffet anymore but they really beautified the establishment with new chairs and decor..  Its really nice and intimate. My wife and i ordered the butter chicken masala and vegetarian mushroom Matar. It was perfectly cooked fresh.  It was not too spicy and the sauce was savory with sweet tomatoe undertones... Kabuli naan was pretty good too.

excerpts: The garlic naan and butter chicken masala are really good.
The renovation this place just completed under new management makes for a brighter experience that is a step above the previous buffet style that it replaced.
Highly recommended.
butter chicken masala.author: Brian R.
butter chicken masala.review: So awesome to live close to this place! The garlic naan and butter chicken masala are really good. The renovation this place just completed under new management makes for a brighter experience that is a step above the previous buffet style that it replaced. Highly recommended.

excerpts: Kashmiri Chicken - $11.95
Our favorite was the Kashmiri Chicken.
kashmiri chicken.author: Jenn H.
kashmiri chicken.review:
I miss the very affordable AYCE place it once used to be, but I LOVE this new place. All the food we ordered came out hot, seasoned to perfection, and reasonably portioned. My husband and I ordered the following:

Tandoori Assorted (chicken, lamb, grilled veggies) - $10.95
Tandoori Chicken Wings - $9.95
Kashmiri Chicken - $11.95
Garlic Naan - $2.95
Tandoori Roti - $2.00
Chai - $4.00

Cannot go wrong with any of the above. Our favorite was the Kashmiri Chicken. It is a sweet, creamy, and rich chicken curry dish. The chicken was buttery soft. The curry could be spicier though.

excerpts: I ordered the vegetable soup and the Kashmiri chicken.
The soup was spicy and very tasty.
Since I hadn't been here before, I decided discretion was the better part of valor and ordered the spice level on the chicken "mild.
"  It was a delicious  dish but
even for my timid taste buds it could have been spicier.
Will definitely ordered "medium" spicy next time and there certainly will be a next time.
For me the servings were generous and I took about half the chicken dish home in a box.
One caveat, service was slow.
We were in no hurry and felt the dishes were prepared to order and not just dished up from a steam table.
Therefore, it was worth the wait.
kashmiri chicken.author: Claire L.
kashmiri chicken.review: Live in the neighborhood and pass this place frequently.  With all the restaurants on Fillmore, I just never got around to trying it.  My loss.  Finally went for the first time today.  Charming decor and pleasant ambiance, very attractive table service.  My companion, a vegetarian, had quite a long selection of vegetarian dishes to choose from.  He ordered samosas and the vegetable momo, a Nepali dish very like light steamed dumplings.  He loved the spice combinations in both the samosa filling and the momo.  I ordered the vegetable soup and the Kashmiri chicken.  The soup was spicy and very tasty.  Since I hadn't been here before, I decided discretion was the better part of valor and ordered the spice level on the chicken "mild."  It was a delicious  dish but even for my timid taste buds it could have been spicier.  Will definitely ordered "medium" spicy next time and there certainly will be a next time.  For me the servings were generous and I took about half the chicken dish home in a box.  One caveat, service was slow.  We were in no hurry and felt the dishes were prepared to order and not just dished up from a steam table.  Therefore, it was worth the wait.

excerpts: Butter chicken and Kadai chicken are delicious!
Ordered them twice
and they were good both times.
Good delivery service, once they reached early!
kadai chicken.author: Thejas K.
kadai chicken.review: Butter chicken and Kadai chicken are delicious! Ordered them twice and they were good both times. Good delivery service, once they reached early! 5/5

excerpts: I had samosas, lamb curry, and chicken korma, and all were perfect.
The lamb was so tender I could smash it with a fork with no effort.
lamb curry.author: Dan L.
lamb curry.review: Possibly best Indian food I've ever had. Inexpensive for anywhere but especially for San Francisco, fast service. I had samosas, lamb curry, and chicken korma, and all were perfect. The lamb was so tender I could smash it with a fork with no effort.

excerpts: To add to my previous review: also love the Lamb rogan josh.
lamb rogan josh.author: JJ M.
lamb rogan josh.review: To add to my previous review: also love the Lamb rogan josh.

excerpts: Lamb Rogan josh, Serrano naan, Jeera rice, with a glass of red wine.
Perfect evening.
Prices are ok, service is swift.
I'll go again.
Thank you Royal.
lamb rogan josh.author: Feroz C.
lamb rogan josh.review: Another great place for Indian food "Royal Indian cuisine" located exactly at Fillmore st between post st and sutter st has won my heart with its great taste and rich flavors. Lamb Rogan josh, Serrano naan, Jeera rice, with a glass of red wine. Perfect evening. Prices are ok, service is swift. I'll go again. Thank you Royal.

excerpts: But the aforementioned exclamation and subsequent explanation came from the awe provoking lamb shank.
lamb shank.author: Dubl A.
lamb shank.review:
Oh sjit!!! Thus spaketh the dude who ordered, when he opened his to go platter.

This freaking spot actually lives up to its name..

Order the veggie momo nice spicy flavor

But the aforementioned exclamation and subsequent explanation came from the awe provoking lamb shank.

This mofo was like the size of mr T.'s bicep!!  No baby ill equipped veal box baby here!!!

Felt like a dog gone sultan eating this prized specimen..  

True royalty while eating on my drive down Fillmore Street in my Chrysler minivan... 

A+ guys. Job well done. Excellent portions. Flavor, freshness... And hooked me up with extra naan!

excerpts: Ive been coming here for Lamb shank
it's so good
I also have tried other stuff which was good
lamb shank.author: Mohammad Z.
lamb shank.review:
Ive been coming here for Lamb shank it's so good 
I also have tried other stuff which was good

excerpts: Lamb shank was so undercooked that it was hard to chew soi
we left our.
The tomato sauce was clearly just added to the cooked lamb shank right before they served it.
Basmati rice was also not cooked well.
The waiter did not even ask why the lamb shank was untouched and most of the 3 orders of basmati rice was not eaten.
lamb shank.author: Nariman R.
lamb shank.review:
Lamb shank was so undercooked that it was hard to chew soi we left our. The tomato sauce was clearly just added to the cooked lamb shank right before they served it. Basmati rice was also not cooked well. Chicken tandoori, we asked for dark meat only and our waiter confirmed the order but still we got breast pieces and thigh. They are audio loading like 1.5 pounds of onion on top of this tandoori to make it look like a large dish. You don't fool anyone.
Waiter forgot to bring us Jeera rice. Then instead of bringing it, he said he will go check if we ordered it. 

We last more that half of what we ordered on the table and asked for check. The waiter did not even ask why the lamb shank was untouched and most of the 3 orders of basmati rice was not eaten. 

To those San Francisco folks who think this is awesome Indian food, you have not had good Indian food. Go eat at Amber at least. Or go 3 doors down and eat at Dosa.

excerpts: We decided to try the Lamb Shank and were so glad we did, thanks to the waiter for the awesome recommendation!
It was super tender, moist, and the sauce was absolutely delicious.
(10/10 would recommend!)
For dessert, we ordered Rice Pudding and it wasn't the jello-like substance I was expecting
lamb shank.author: Ashley O.
lamb shank.review:
My friend and I were craving some Indian food the other day and looked on Yelp for some inspiration when we found this place! For the appetizer, we had Papadum which is like a thin, crispy, biscuit accompanied with three yummy sauces. What really grabbed my attention was the Garlic Naan. Never really been a fan of naan but this Garlic Naan was sooo fresh and perfectly toasted, I got a little sad when I looked down and realized I had already finished it so quick. We decided to try the Lamb Shank and were so glad we did, thanks to the waiter for the awesome recommendation! It was super tender, moist, and the sauce was absolutely delicious. (10/10 would recommend!) For dessert, we ordered Rice Pudding and it wasn't the jello-like substance I was expecting but it was really good and definitely satisfied my sweet tooth :)

In addition to good quality food and service, the ambiance was also great. Some restaurants either have super loud music playing or obnoxious bright lights, but I noticed that this place had a nice, dim lighting configuration and soft music playing in the background. (Perfect place to bring a date!)

Definitely coming back for round 2.

excerpts: so we got the Lamb Shank.
It was tender and moist
lamb shank.author: Jeff K.
lamb shank.review:
I noticed this new spot had multiple 5 star reviews and decided to try it out. Noticed some Yelpers were doubting all the positive feedback. This just made me more curious, and hungry! Sometimes you just need to see for yourself. 

Started with a Papadum appetizer, which is like a big cracker with 3 dipping sauces. We also had the Garlic Naan which was so fresh and delicious,....I could eat it all day.

For entrees, I asked the waiter to recommend something with chicken and he suggested the Chicken Chilli, which I had never had before. It was a solid choice and I'd surely get it again.

I was craving lamb so we got the Lamb Shank. It was tender and moist and I loved the flavor of the marinade, it really hit the spot!

For dessert, we had Rice pudding.

***At the end of the meal, we saw another couple had ordered Tandoori. They brought it out on a sizzling platter, filling the place with an intoxicating aroma,....Oh God. Even though I was full, it smelled so good that I vowed to order it when we return, which we will! 

No question, easy 5 stars.

excerpts: We got seekh kebab and salmon vindaloo with some rice and naan.
The spices were right on point
but however I do think that they should give some complimentary rice with curries.
salmon vindaloo.author: Vimpy G.
salmon vindaloo.review: We ordered through Ubereats  and it took forever for the driver to deliver the food to us. We had called the restaurant so many times to ask about the status and the guy over the phone was extremely helpful and the good part is we found out that they do free home delivery . Now lets talk about food. OMG  food over here is amazing. We got seekh kebab and salmon vindaloo with some rice and naan. The spices were right on point but however I do think that they should give some complimentary rice with curries.

excerpts: Also very fragrant and flavorful- the chicken biryani, Shrimp tikka masala (spicy), and the seekh kabobs.
shrimp tikka masala.author: K C.
shrimp tikka masala.review:
If you crave that spice fix you can only get from authentic Indian food, this is the place! My favorites are chicken tikka masala (spicy), garlic naan, lamb chops, and of course, chicken momos. 

Also very fragrant and flavorful- the chicken biryani, Shrimp tikka masala (spicy), and the seekh kabobs. 

Everything tastes a little bit better spicy, as hot as you can eat it, and followed by a delicious mango lassi.

The ambiance is very nice and comfortable. The service is really great.

excerpts: I ordered chicken korma, my brother ordered shrimp tikka masala.
The chicken korma was definitely solid, but I thought it could've been a little thicker.
The portion was pretty small as well - too small for 1 serving of naan.
The service was good.
If I live here I'd visit this place on a regular basis.
shrimp tikka masala.author: Karl S.
shrimp tikka masala.review: We came here with empty stomachs. We shared samosa, rice, and garlic naan. I ordered chicken korma, my brother ordered shrimp tikka masala. The samosa was great: clean and not salty but perfectly spiced. The naan was great but I thought it could've been crispier, perhaps I was just biased since my goto Indian place in NYC had really crispy (yet soft inside) naan. The chicken korma was definitely solid, but I thought it could've been a little thicker. The portion was pretty small as well - too small for 1 serving of naan. The service was good. If I live here I'd visit this place on a regular basis.

excerpts: I love their shrimp tikka masala!
Full of flavor!
Not to mention the texture of the shrimp is perfect with the luscious texture of the tikka sauce.
Service is great and I will definitely recommend this to family and friends.
Of course, I have a favorite spot now for Indian food!
shrimp tikka masala.author: Hazel B.
shrimp tikka masala.review: I love their shrimp tikka masala!  Full of flavor!  Not to mention the texture of the shrimp is perfect with the luscious texture of the tikka sauce.  Service is great and I will definitely recommend this to family and friends.  Of course, I have a favorite spot now for Indian food!

excerpts: However, the chicken tikka masala was bland and the shrimp vindaloo was really watery and also very bland.
Hopefully this was just an off night for them.
shrimp vindaloo.author: Lester W.
shrimp vindaloo.review:
There were obviously a lot of fake 5-star reviews for this restaurant, but we tried it anyways.

Delivery was faster than expected. The garlic naan bread was delicious. The aloo gobi had the perfect amount of spices.

However, the chicken tikka masala was bland and the shrimp vindaloo was really watery and also very bland. Hopefully this was just an off night for them.

excerpts: I thought I hated rice but the jeera rice was like something I want with every meal now
but I can't make it
jeera rice.author: Juliette H.
jeera rice.review:
I don't know Indian cuisine that well and I've only had a few dishes here but this is a place that I will keep coming to because it's so damn tasty and I plan on working my way through the whole menu. The chicken vindaloo is so flavorful and just enough heat. Tonight I had the tandoori chicken and again, very flavorful. I thought I hated rice but the jeera rice was like something I want with every meal now but I can't make it so I guess I'll just have to keep eating here. 

The ambiance is casual and the service has always been great. Also it's pretty cheap for SF. I had the tandoori chicken, rice, laccha paratha, and a glass of wine which set me back $29 for meal and $6 for tip. Btw, I have enough leftovers for another meal and snack.

excerpts: Waiter forgot to bring us Jeera rice.
jeera rice.author: Nariman R.
jeera rice.review:
Lamb shank was so undercooked that it was hard to chew soi we left our. The tomato sauce was clearly just added to the cooked lamb shank right before they served it. Basmati rice was also not cooked well. Chicken tandoori, we asked for dark meat only and our waiter confirmed the order but still we got breast pieces and thigh. They are audio loading like 1.5 pounds of onion on top of this tandoori to make it look like a large dish. You don't fool anyone.
Waiter forgot to bring us Jeera rice. Then instead of bringing it, he said he will go check if we ordered it. 

We last more that half of what we ordered on the table and asked for check. The waiter did not even ask why the lamb shank was untouched and most of the 3 orders of basmati rice was not eaten. 

To those San Francisco folks who think this is awesome Indian food, you have not had good Indian food. Go eat at Amber at least. Or go 3 doors down and eat at Dosa.

excerpts: Lamb Rogan josh, Serrano naan, Jeera rice, with a glass of red wine.
Perfect evening.
Prices are ok, service is swift.
I'll go again.
Thank you Royal.
jeera rice.author: Feroz C.
jeera rice.review: Another great place for Indian food "Royal Indian cuisine" located exactly at Fillmore st between post st and sutter st has won my heart with its great taste and rich flavors. Lamb Rogan josh, Serrano naan, Jeera rice, with a glass of red wine. Perfect evening. Prices are ok, service is swift. I'll go again. Thank you Royal.

excerpts: Split the Vegetarian Thali for 2 with a side of chicken biryani.
Of the 5 Indian places in the city I've tried it has been by far the best.
Ordering our meal "spicy" actually resulted in spicy food.
vegetarian thali for.author: R M.
vegetarian thali for.review: Split the Vegetarian Thali for 2 with a side of chicken biryani. Of the 5 Indian places in the city I've tried it has been by far the best. Ordering our meal "spicy" actually resulted in spicy food. The daal makhani and the biryani were standout. It's not the best I've ever had, but the the best I've had in SF. Will definitely return.

excerpts:
We ordered the 
"Royal Thali Special for 2:
royal thali special for.author: Emma B.
royal thali special for.review:
I was really pleased with delivery from this restaurant. It came quickly and was still warm.
We ordered the 
"Royal Thali Special for 2: Starter: pappadum, samosa. Entrees: chicken tikka masala, saag paneer, tandoori chicken with boti, side of rice and naan. Dessert: kheer" for $42.

excerpts: Chicken Tikka Kebab:
The portion was generous, however the chicken was dry and had no flavor.
The menu claimed it is marinated-
chicken tikka kebab.author: Gene G.
chicken tikka kebab.review:
Chicken Tikka Kebab: The portion was generous, however the chicken was dry and had no flavor. The menu claimed it is marinated- it clearly had not been.

Baigan Bharta (eggplant curry): Too oily. Did not have peas as promised in the menu. Flavor was OK.

Saag Paneer: Too oily. Good flavor though.

Kabuli Naan: Good flavor, however for $4 it was too small. Other than the pink, shredded coconut, you couldn't taste or see any of the other ingredients it was supposed to have.

Samosas: Crispy and chewy- I think they use a little cornstarch in the dough. Filling was flavorful.

Vegetarian Momos: The filling was unremarkable- some kind of green paste with no defining flavor. The dough was some kind of thin, translucent rice paper or cornstarch mixture- not at all what you expect from momos. The skins dried out almost immediately. They try to mitigate this by brushing them in oil- yuck.

Service was polite and the decor/ambiance pleasant. Would not return for the food though.

excerpts: The tandoori shrimp was the best I have had, even in England.
Can't recommend this place enough......try it you won't be sorry.
tandoori shrimp.author: Barbara D.
tandoori shrimp.review: What a wonderful surprise.....there was another Indian restaurant here but when we thought we were going to that one we walked into Royal Indian and immediately knew it was different and much more attractive. The food was really really good and the service very pleasant and timely. The tandoori shrimp was the best I have had, even in England. Can't recommend this place enough......try it you won't be sorry.

excerpts:
My favorites are chicken tikka masala (spicy), garlic naan, lamb chops, and of course, chicken momos. 

Also very fragrant and flavorful- the chicken biryani, Shrimp tikka masala (spicy), and the seekh kabobs.
lamb chops.author: K C.
lamb chops.review:
If you crave that spice fix you can only get from authentic Indian food, this is the place! My favorites are chicken tikka masala (spicy), garlic naan, lamb chops, and of course, chicken momos. 

Also very fragrant and flavorful- the chicken biryani, Shrimp tikka masala (spicy), and the seekh kabobs. 

Everything tastes a little bit better spicy, as hot as you can eat it, and followed by a delicious mango lassi.

The ambiance is very nice and comfortable. The service is really great.

excerpts: I had the tandoori chicken, rice, laccha paratha, and a glass of wine which set me back $29 for meal and $6 for tip.
Btw, I have enough leftovers for another meal and snack.
laccha paratha.author: Juliette H.
laccha paratha.review:
I don't know Indian cuisine that well and I've only had a few dishes here but this is a place that I will keep coming to because it's so damn tasty and I plan on working my way through the whole menu. The chicken vindaloo is so flavorful and just enough heat. Tonight I had the tandoori chicken and again, very flavorful. I thought I hated rice but the jeera rice was like something I want with every meal now but I can't make it so I guess I'll just have to keep eating here. 

The ambiance is casual and the service has always been great. Also it's pretty cheap for SF. I had the tandoori chicken, rice, laccha paratha, and a glass of wine which set me back $29 for meal and $6 for tip. Btw, I have enough leftovers for another meal and snack.

excerpts: We had laccha paratha and butter naan.
The paratha was super wheaty, which was fit the bill for whole wheat.
laccha paratha.author: masa s.
laccha paratha.review:
I really liked the old place. I mean, it wasn't all that good, and, even though they'd raised their prices, it was still a pretty good deal on the buffet. So, when I saw this new place, I was skeptical, but still willing to give it a try.

The food was delicious. We started with the baingan pakora. It was good for what it was, but I think I'd get the mixed vegetables. Our two entrees were spot on good. They vary the spiciness, but the mild/medium/spicy is still pretty subjective. I thought they did it appropriately - medium hit the range for my wife and me (max comfort for her, just enough to taste for me). We had laccha paratha and butter naan. The paratha was super wheaty, which was fit the bill for whole wheat. The naan was both fluffy *and* crispy.

I went in dehydrated, so I was gulping down water, and the waiter was constantly running over to refill my water right on cue - attentive without hovering.

We'll definitely go back, and might be doing delivery or pick up.

excerpts: We ordered roti, butter naan and butter chicken, the gravy was amazinggg!!
Creamy and delicious!!
The quantity was enough for 2 people.
butter naan.author: Saarthak C.
butter naan.review:
Craving for Indian food? This is an amazing restaurant: heads up: they don't have buffers !! I was surprised too since I've rarely seen an Indian restaurant without a buffet.

We ordered roti, butter naan and butter chicken, the gravy was amazinggg!! Creamy and delicious!! The quantity was enough for 2 people. The roti bread was good food, and with prompt servers, I had no complains whatsoever.

Great food,  wish the restaurant was a bit bigger in size, but I didn't have to wait so no complains :)

excerpts: We ordered vegetable momo, butter naan, chicken tikka masala, coconut vegetable curry, and rice (you do have to order rice separately-
it does not come with the entrees).
Flavors were full and fantastic.
Servings were generous.
butter naan.author: Elizabeth D.
butter naan.review: Some of the best Indian food that I've had. We ordered vegetable momo, butter naan, chicken tikka masala, coconut vegetable curry, and rice (you do have to order rice separately- it does not come with the entrees). Flavors were full and fantastic. Servings were generous.

excerpts: It consisted of samosas for starter, followed by Saag paneer and Dal makhani served with butter naan and rice.
butter naan.author: Nishith M.
butter naan.review:
Originally planned to go to DOSA but it was closed for lunch. That is when we decided to try out this little gem.

Interiors were nice and clean. We got the vegetarian thali which was basically a three course meal for two. It consisted of samosas for starter, followed by Saag paneer and Dal makhani served with butter naan and rice. I loved the kheer for desert. Would recommend. Also got sweet lassi which was ok.

Overall good service and solid food at a decent price point (under $50 for 2)

excerpts:
*Serrano Chili Naan: Naan brushed with blended green chili ($2.95)

I adored the curry.
serrano chili naan.author: Elena N.
serrano chili naan.review:
I stayed out a little too late on Friday. So when I woke up, I was starving. Decided to get delivery through Eat24 on Saturday, September 22nd. I placed my lunch order at 2:45pm. It arrived at 3:45pm. I live in Outer Richmond.

*Samosa: Homemade crispy Indian pastry stuffed with spiced peas and potatoes, Served with homemade mint chutney, hot and sour and tamarind chutney, All batters are signature chickpea (garbanzo batter) prepared by our chef ($4.95)
*Chicken Momo: Nepali delicacy cooked with ground chicken and Himalayan spices filled in cover with thin flour dough and steamed ($8.95)
*Chicken Tikka Masala: Roasted chicken breast cooked in creamy tomato and onion sauce, Extra spicy ($12.95)
*Garlic Naan: Naan layered with freshly minced garlic and chopped cilantro ($2.95)
*Serrano Chili Naan: Naan brushed with blended green chili ($2.95)

I adored the curry. It was creamy and comforting. Could have used a little more spice as I wanted it extra spicy, but it had a good amount of heat. The naan were both soft with a nice chew. Though, I do think they could have used more garlic and chili. The flavors weren't strong enough for me. The samosas were good. Crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Though their mint chutney was very bland and watery. Didn't really stick to the samosas. I love dumplings so the momos were tasty. The dipping sauce complemented them well.

Indian is my comfort food and this hit the spot. Especially since I was feeling a little delicate that day.

excerpts: I ordered a serrano chili naan, which I really loved and recommend.
serrano chili naan.author: Apoorva A.
serrano chili naan.review:
Delicious food! We ordered the baigan bhartha, shahi paneer, and malai kofta. Everything was very well seasoned, and just as spicy as we asked for. I especially recommend the malai kofta. They all had a little too much cream, but that's to be expected from restaurant food. The downside is naan or rice are not included with the entrees, so you have to order them separately. I ordered a serrano chili naan, which I really loved and recommend.

We came during lunch time on a Sunday, and it was pretty busy. Turns out, this place is owned by the same people who run Om Indian Cuisine in Haight-Ashbury, and they just opened another restaurant as well. The ambience is alright, a little dark (I think Om does a better job here). Service was also a little slow. They brought out our three different appetizers one at a time, perhaps in order to buy time for the entrees, which came a good 25 minutes after the order was placed. However, it was well worth the wait, and, overall, made for a great meal.

excerpts: Most of the reviews are fake for sure, but I liked it, especially the missi roti (chick pea bread).
missi roti.author: Andrew K.
missi roti.review: Most of the reviews are fake for sure, but I liked it, especially the missi roti (chick pea bread). Also solid were the butter chicken and daal saag. I'd return!

excerpts: Tried the momos, dal soup, navratan korma, baingan bartha, missi roti, pudina parata, and lacha parata.
Service is excellent.
missi roti.author: Karthik G.
missi roti.review: Coming in, I was wondering how can a place have so many 5 stars. Am now convinced that this places deserves it's unanimous MVP rating. Tried the momos, dal soup, navratan korma, baingan bartha, missi roti, pudina parata, and lacha parata. Service is excellent.

excerpts: Gulab jamun
and you bring rasmali and say that every restaurant has its own menu and food.
No!
There are some things which are standard and you need to stick to what they are when you are naming them.
What you served was a Three course meal and not a Thali.

And to the point where you said we questioned only when the bill came up,of course we were taken aback to see 85$ for 2 Thalis which would have normally costed us less than 50$.And in the beginning when we were given 4 samosas the server told us that 2 Thalis were a lot of food,then I immediately told we will cancel one and he said no you cannot as we already brought the samosas!(if he would have cancelled then, all this chaos wouldn't have happened)
So the whole situation arose because you used a Standard item Thali and made it into whatever you want.
You are free to do it
but it's your responsibility to explain it to your customers and not think that it's a headache to the servers.
You wasted our time,money and we left your restaurant completely disappointed with your hospitality.
gulab jamun.author: Ramya R.
gulab jamun.review:
This update is in response to Mr.Ajay's reply to my review-
First of all please Google or find out from restauranteurs in India what a"Thali" is- your justification is -when I order Gulab jamun and you bring rasmali and say that every restaurant has its own menu and food.
No! There are some things which are standard and you need to stick to what they are when you are naming them.What you served was a Three course meal and not a Thali.

excerpts: Kheer.
kheer.author: Jen W.
kheer.review:
Apparently under new management and slightly remodeled, this place has improved slightly from the previous owners.  We had a hankering for some Indian food after work and remembered this spot out in the Fillmore.  No buffet options anymore either.  

Although they were busy, there was an table available for us and didn't have to wait.  We decided to go with the Thali special for 2:  STARTER: Pappadum, Samosa ENTREES: Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Tandoori Chicken with Boti, Side of Rice & Naan. DESSERT: Kheer.  Such a steal for a little over $40.  

My favorite dish was the tandoori which was perfectly spiced and came out sizzling on a hot plate.  The naan also stood out as the texture was spot on.  The not so greats?  The saag paneer was quite plain and the tikka masala was also slightly bland.  Were they terrible?  No, but I've definitely had better.

I have to say that the portions were huge though.  We definitely needed doggie bags and had dinner for the next night.  

Service was slow but they were efficient.  3.5 stars and a good option for Indian food in the area.
